jobs.title: Manager Data Application Engineer
jobs.description:
**Who are we ?**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven information system, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and information system are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

To support and develop its growth, Artefact is looking for the next talents of the data divizion to join the engineering team. Organized in feature team, you will work in project mode (ou pizza team) to  advise your clients on their IA problematics, machine learning and Big Data. The projects you will work on can go from the migration of infrastructure to the Cloud (Deezer) to the construction of a predictive model  of the water rises (Greenpeace).

**Your assignments :**

**Management** : You work within a team where mutual aid and development of competences are key, you coach interns and juniors, you carry out technological monitoring, you take part in technical training given by our partners such as Google or Azure. 

**Delivery** : You are full owner of the front to back solution, responsible for devising, implementing and deploying it. You work within a team made up of engineers, consultants, data scientists, strategic planners to identify your client needs and define innovative solutions. 

**Project** : You are a key actor to company success participating in pitches and securing deals.  Your technical capacities will allow you forge ties with your clients while accompanying and guiding them in their data and digital transformation. You will contribute to making Artefact an essential business partner.

**Consulting:** You are adept at choosing and setting up the most suitable technical stack based on your client's needs. You have a critical mindset to understand and optimize the organisational functioning of large firms.

**Your mindset** [ ](mailto:Talents-fr@artefact.com)

**Curious**** ,** you are always on the lookout for the latest solutions to best meet client needs. You’re actively involved in the entire value chain, whether it be front-end, back end, big data infrastructure, ML model… [ ](mailto:Talents-fr@artefact.com)

**Entrepreneurial spirit** , you come up with solutions, new ideas not only within your team  but also within the entire Artefact world  
  
**Benevolent** , your team fulfillment is key for you, thanks to constructive feedback you guide,drive and make your collaborators grow[ ](mailto:Talents-fr@artefact.com)

**Advocate** of knowledge sharing, you actively participate in circulating information within Artefact (seminars, trainings, certifications, online KM)   
[ ](mailto:Talents-fr@artefact.com)

**Profile:**

Ideally you hold a masters in Software Engineering or possibly machine Learning, mathematics, or computer science

Minimum three years of experience developing and implementing data driven solutions within a consulting firm    
  
You have the capacity to actively participate in all the project value chain ( building infrastructure and platforms, collecting data, machine learning application models, setting up API’s REST, tests and continuous deployment)   
  
You have in-depth knowledge of Python, you have a strong interest for DevOps, you’re familiar with Cloud technologies such as GCP or Azure. You master data technologies like Spark or Beam, with previous experience of Docker (Kubernetes is a plus) 

You’re a ninja of the use and exploitation of data bus like Kafka or PubSub

You have practiced indexation system such as ElasticSearch and Vespa. Ideally, you have implementation experience of a LETOR   
  
You have a proven capacity to vulgarize technical terms and solutions for those coming from the business field, you are a key player in a diverse team

You can foresee projects risks and mitigate them through your technological choices  
  
You have a working command of business English

**Why us ?**  
  
Cutting edge stack : Python,Kubernetes, Spinnaker, Kafka, Spark, Google Cloud Platform (BQ, Dataflow, Compute Engine, PubSub, AppEngine…) , Airflow, Docker

Wide variety of  projects :   
- Datalake set up    
- Chatbot building    
- Industrialisation of machine learning algorithms   
- Define the data strategy 

Young and challenging environment of skilled engineers , grow your skills thanks to our mentoring program

Internationally renowned : offices in Dubaï, London, Hong Kong, Sao Paulo 

**Come join us #FR !**

[Talents-fr@artefact.com](mailto:Talents-fr@artefact.com)

[ ](mailto:Talents-fr@artefact.com)

jobs.title: Paid Search Manager
jobs.description:
**Who we are**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

**The Role**

Our luxury retail team is looking for a passionate and ambitious PPC Account Manager.

As a PPC Account Manager, you'll be taking ownership of the creation, optimisation and future development of the allocated Paid Search portfolios. You will manage a team of one or more Account Executives and you will be able to experiment and innovate your client’s activity via new beta and tactics.

You will be part of Artefact Retail, a collective of 40+ individuals experienced in media planning and activation for retailers and e-tailers. 

If you have a passion for retail, data and are looking to make a positive impact on the PPC activity of the best department store in the World, this is the role for you!

** **

**Main responsibilities**

- 

Manage the day-to-day communication with your client, building and maintaining strong working relationships

Liaise with third party providers like Google and feed provider

- 

Ensure that everyone you manage has regular appraisals, clear objectives and a career plan to work towards and that they have the skills required to meet your client’s objectives

- 

Three years’ paid search agency experience

- 

Advanced knowledge and understanding of PPC

Experience in managing Google Shopping campaigns

Excellent project management and prioritisation skills, with experience of managing a team

jobs.title: SEO Executive
jobs.description:
**Who we are**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

### Role purpose

You will support the client team with the day-to-day running of client accounts, focusing on SEO campaigns and delivery. You will research and prepare project documentation and analysis, undertake SEO campaign work and liaise with clients and internal teams to ensure optimal project delivery.

### Main responsibilities

**General responsibilities**

- Support the team with the day-to-day running of client accounts
- Assist in taking client briefs
- Carry out accurate reporting, analysis, research and insights for existing projects and for new business
- Research and prepare project documentation, presentations, analysis and reports
- Prepare cost estimates, project schedules, budgets and timelines
- Coordinate internal project teams and third-party suppliers
- Carry out account administration as required, including but not limited to, note taking, booking meetings and drafting agendas
- Take on ad-hoc tasks as required

 

**SEO delivery**

- Deliver SEO campaign work for key client accounts as assigned to you by the team in order to increase performance and drive success
- Carry out technical changes to clients’ websites as required
- Carry out advanced and detailed keyword research to identify the most effective and targeted key phrases for each client’s SEO campaign
- Produce detailed technical SEO reports, using a variety of proprietary and 3rd party reporting tools for existing and potential customers
- Use a variety of analytical tools to assess competitor activity and profiles, establish client share of voice and spot opportunities for growth
- Understand the client’s products and services, and contribute to client search marketing campaign and objectives
- Carry out objective testing of SEO tools resources and techniques
- Research opportunities for content placement and syndication with providers relevant to client niche and target audience
- Use a variety of analytical tools to assess competitor market activity and profiles, identifying opportunities for growth and promotion
- Proactively seek training and continuing professional development to stay up to date with developments, algorithm updates and process changes

### Skills required

### Essential

- 1 years + experience in SEO in a digital marketing environment
- Good understanding of search marketing and the factors that influence client websites, search profiles and performance
- Comprehensive understanding and passion for digital, web analytics and PPC
- Ability to conduct research and present back findings coherently
- Ability to multi task in a fast-moving environment
- Initiative and self-motivation
- Excellent attention to detail
- Strong excel and word experience
- Confident communication skills

jobs.title: SEO Manager
jobs.description:
### **Who we are**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

### Role purpose

You will be responsible for managing the day-to-day client relationship and for the delivery of SEO campaigns for your clients. You will manage a number of clients with a revenue totalling £250k, partnering with your clients to drive client strategy and account profitability and to grow your business by 20% year on year.  You will work with a cross-channel team, delegating work effectively to ensure it is always of the highest possible standard and to ensure client retention and satisfaction.

### Main responsibilities

**Client management**

- Manage the relationship between the agency and number of clients with a revenue totalling £250k.
- Work with the Senior Account Manager and Account Director to develop a business growth plan for your clients, ensuring 20% year on year growth and a strategy plan for existing business that meets client needs
- Ensure delivery against the agreed business growth and strategy plan
- Maintain client retention and satisfaction, retaining 80% of your clients and maintaining a client satisfaction score of 8/10
- Run monthly business reviews for each of your clients
- Project-manage and deliver end-to-end SEO campaign performance
- Monitor campaign performance, timelines and budgets and report on these regularly to the account director and the client
- Manage the day-to-day relationship with clients, building and maintaining strong working relationships so that they trust and value your opinions
- Liaise with clients regularly (responding to briefs, attending meetings, status reporting, information seeking, managing milestones and approvals)
- Identify and resolve issues before they arise
- Give good strategic advice to clients based upon previous experience
- Manage and work collaboratively with cross channel teams to ensure the best result for your clients.

 

**SEO delivery**

- Lead the delivery of on-site and off-site SEO campaigns for key client accounts in order to increase performance and drive success based on agreed KPI’s
- Proactively recommend changes to drive campaign success and ensure these are delivered effectively by your team
- Lead your team in the delivery of complex web migrations and international SEO strategies
- Lead your team in the production of advanced and detailed keyword research to identify the most effective and targeted key phrases for each client’s SEO campaign
- Proactively define best practice methodology and ensure it is applied to all campaigns
- Lead your team in the production of detailed technical SEO reports, using a variety of proprietary and 3rd party reporting tools for existing and potential customers. Present the results of these reports to stakeholders
- Use a variety of analytical tools to assess competitor activity and profiles, establish client share of voice and spot opportunities for growth
- Understand the client’s products and services, and use this to drive client search marketing campaign and objectives
- Carry out objective testing of SEO tools resources and techniques
- Regularly monitor client websites, SERPs and analytics tools and feedback on any significant changes
- Proactively seek training and continuing professional development to stay up to date with developments, algorithm updates and process changes.

 

**Leadership & management**

- Ensure that everyone you manage has regular appraisals, clear objectives and a career plan to work towards and that they have the skills required to meet your client’s objectives

### Skills required

**Essential**

- Three years’ SEO agency experience

- Broad digital marketing knowledge with an in-depth understanding of search marketing and the factors that influence client websites, search profiles and performance. Record of applying this knowledge to achieve results for clients
- Awareness of and active integration with other digital channels such as PPC, Display and UX

- Ability to multi-task in a fast-moving environment
- Excellent project management and campaign leadership skills, with experience of managing budgets, estimates and schedules
- Strong client management skills with the proven ability to add value to clients
- Strong problem-solving/troubleshooting skills

### Desirable

- Management experience
- Experience of running projects of £50k + from start to finish

 

### Technical

- Basic HTML / CSS / JavaScript or Jquery knowledge
- Experience with SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, SEMrush, aHREFs, Brightedge, Linkdex and Moz
- Experience with Google Analytics, Omniture, Site Catalyst (or other analytics tools), Google and Bing Search Console and SEO performance measurement using these tools
- Basic knowledge of Google Tag Manager and tag creation.
- Detailed understanding of technical SEO best practice including HTML meta tags, URL structure, schema.org markup for desktop and mobile search
- Knowledge of robots control and site indexing principles including robots.txt, meta robots tags, canonical tag, XML sitemaps
- Up-to-date knowledge of key search algorithms and google best practice guidelines.
- Ability to identify low quality SEO practices such as link building or cloaking.
- Experience developing organic search strategies including site architecture changes, robots control, schema.org
- Experience with writing HTTP redirect rules for website migration strategies including Apache (including HTTPS migrations)
- Experience writing HREF Lang mark-up and developing international SEO strategies.
- Appreciation of UX best practice principles and how these should align with SEO recommendations
- Solid understanding of paramater handling, pagination, filtering and duplicate content solutions
- Experience with SEO KPI definition

jobs.title: Senior Content Manager
jobs.description:
**Who we are**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specializing in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

**What you will be doing**

- Identify and understand customer objectives in terms of communication and content marketing strategy, by starting the content conversation with them.
- Develop content training to help our clients to get their (new) employees up to speed.
- Learning our clients that the content journey is about halfway when you’ve published it on their website
- Map out content strategies for our clients. Where you understand that publicizing a piece of content is just the beginning of a content marketing strategy.
- Work together with our team on pitches for potential clients.
- Building and maintaining a network of specialized PR-agents , copywriters, peers and publicist.
- Follow-up performances, reports and budgets.
- Incidentally you will have to pick up the pen and write content yourself.

**What we are looking for**

- **Your values**

  - **Empathy**  : *You value our coworker’s feelings first*
  - **Collaboration** : *You believe people are smarter as a diverse team*
  - **Engagement** : *You are biased to action*
  - **Data and web culture** : You believe that *everything starts with data*
  - **Customer obsession** : *You go the extra mile for our clients*

- **Your Education**

  - Bachelor degree in the digital sector, marketing or communication.

- **Your Experience**

  - A minimum of 2 years experience in a similar job.

- **Your Skills**

  - Knowledge of the impact of content on SEO.
  - A great networker, to get things done and get people aligned.
  - Able to work in multiple Content Management systems (WordPress, Sitecore, Magento, CommerceCloud, Hippo, to name a few)
  - Knowledge of the impact of different channels in the content strategy.
  - MS Office mastery (PPT, Excel)
  - Excellent communication and persuasiveness (written & oral)

- **Your Language Mastery**

  - Fluent in Dutch and English, mastering a third language would be a plus.

**Why you should join us**

- **Place to be** : data and its application in marketing is a hot topic, the type of success that everyone wants on their resume
- **Knowledge** : with Artefact you will build a true technical expertise while leveraging the methodologies and rigor of consulting
- **Entrepreneurs** : you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent into this industry!

jobs.title: Senior Data Analyst
jobs.description:
## **Who we are**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven information system, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and information system are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

To support and develop its growth, Artefact is looking for the next talents of the data divizion to join the engineering team. Organized in feature team, you will work in project mode (ou pizza team) to advise your clients on their IA problematics, machine learning and Big Data. The projects you will work on can go from the migration of infrastructure to the Cloud (Deezer) to the construction of a predictive model of the water rises (Greenpeace).

 

## **What you will be doing: Key responsibilities**

**As a Data Analyst, your role will encompass:**

- Conducting projects to accompany the transformation of your clients’ businesses through the effective collection, processing, and visualisation of data
- Extracting valuable insights from our clients’ marketing-related data sources.
- Designing dashboards for marketing decision-making while taking into account the business needs
- Accompanying our clients in the conception and implementation of data architectures and data pipelines, from collection to monitoring.
- Actively contributing to the expertise level and competencies of the Data & Analytics team
- Closely collaborate with the other divisions (Media & Activation, Creation, Consulting, Data Science and Data Engineer) to provide comprehensive services to your clients

**Being a great tech role model**

- Demonstrating the skill and credibility required to ensure the success of our clients’ initiatives
- Researching and developing new technical approaches to address problems efficiently
- Staying up-to-date on developments within the industry, sharing best practices and actively contributing to Artefact’s institutional knowledge
- Embodying Artefact’s values and inspiring others to do the same

 

## **Qualifications: Education & experience required**

- Academic level of education (Bachelor or Master)
- A minimum of 3 years of work experience as a data specialist
- Verifiable knowledge and experience of web analytics platforms like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, WebTrekk etc.
- Verifiable knowledge and experience of tag management systems like Google Tag Manager, Tag Commander, Tealium IQ Tag Management, Relay42 etc.
- Verifiable knowledge and experience of website optimization tools like Optimizely, Google Optimize, Convert, AB Tasty etc.
- Knowledge of Data Management Platforms like BlueKai, Krux, Ysance, Weborama, Relay42, Adobe Audience Manager, Tealium Audience Streams etc.
- Knowledge of computer and web-related technologies:
  - Network techniques/protocols
  - JavaScript, CSS and HTML (optionally AJAX, JSON, Angular)
  - Database techniques (REST API’s, SQL, No-SQL)
  - Cloud technology (Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure)
- Optionally, knowledge of data processing and data modeling algorithms and techniques

 

## **What we are looking for**

- **A Doer:**  you get things done and inspire your team to do the same
- **An Analyst: ** you LOVE data and think every company should take their decisions based on facts
- **A Pragmatist:**  you have a no-nonsense mindset that seeks for practical and realistic solutions
- **A Mentor:**  your clients and colleagues naturally seek you out for advice
- **An Adventurer: ** you’re an entrepreneur constantly looking for business opportunities

## **Why you should join us**

- **Artefact is the place to be: ** come and build the future of marketing
- **Progress:**  every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
- **Culture:**  join the best team you could ever imagine

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Who we are

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven information system, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and information system are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

To support and develop its growth, Artefact is looking for the next talents of the data divizion to join the engineering team. Organized in feature team, you will work in project mode (ou pizza team) to advise your clients on their IA problematics, machine learning and Big Data. The projects you will work on can go from the migration of infrastructure to the Cloud (Deezer) to the construction of a predictive model of the water rises (Greenpeace).

What you will be doing: Key responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, your role will encompass:

  • Conducting projects to accompany the transformation of your clients’ businesses through the effective collection, processing, and visualisation of data
  • Extracting valuable insights from our clients’ marketing-related data sources.
  • Designing dashboards for marketing decision-making while taking into account the business needs
  • Accompanying our clients in the conception and implementation of data architectures and data pipelines, from collection to monitoring.
  • Actively contributing to the expertise level and competencies of the Data & Analytics team
  • Closely collaborate with the other divisions (Media & Activation, Creation, Consulting, Data Science and Data Engineer) to provide comprehensive services to your clients

Being a great tech role model

  • Demonstrating the skill and credibility required to ensure the success of our clients’ initiatives
  • Researching and developing new technical approaches to address problems efficiently
  • Staying up-to-date on developments within the industry, sharing best practices and actively contributing to Artefact’s institutional knowledge
  • Embodying Artefact’s values and inspiring others to do the same

Qualifications: Education & experience required

  • Academic level of education (Bachelor or Master)
  • A minimum of 3 years of work experience as a data specialist
  • Verifiable knowledge and experience of web analytics platforms like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, WebTrekk etc.
  • Verifiable knowledge and experience of tag management systems like Google Tag Manager, Tag Commander, Tealium IQ Tag Management, Relay42 etc.
  • Verifiable knowledge and experience of website optimization tools like Optimizely, Google Optimize, Convert, AB Tasty etc.
  • Knowledge of Data Management Platforms like BlueKai, Krux, Ysance, Weborama, Relay42, Adobe Audience Manager, Tealium Audience Streams etc.
  • Knowledge of computer and web-related technologies:
    • Network techniques/protocols
    • JavaScript, CSS and HTML (optionally AJAX, JSON, Angular)
    • Database techniques (REST API’s, SQL, No-SQL)
    • Cloud technology (Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure)
  • Optionally, knowledge of data processing and data modeling algorithms and techniques

What we are looking for

  • A Doer: you get things done and inspire your team to do the same
  • *An Analyst: * you LOVE data and think every company should take their decisions based on facts
  • A Pragmatist: you have a no-nonsense mindset that seeks for practical and realistic solutions
  • A Mentor: your clients and colleagues naturally seek you out for advice
  • *An Adventurer: * you’re an entrepreneur constantly looking for business opportunities

Why you should join us

  • *Artefact is the place to be: * come and build the future of marketing
  • Progress: every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
  • Culture: join the best team you could ever imagine
  • *Entrepreneurship: * you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

Come join us!

- Communicating the successes of your projects within the company and externally
- Working closely with experts from the other divisions to build and maintain strong relationships with your clients and best understand their needs
- Caring for the happiness of the team, ensuring work is delivered to a high standard and providing feedback and mentoring

Being a great tech role model

- Demonstrating the skill and credibility required to ensure the success of our clients’ initiatives
- Researching and developing new technical approaches to address problems efficiently

  - Network techniques/protocols
  - JavaScript, CSS and HTML (optionally AJAX, JSON, Angular)
  - Database techniques (REST API’s, SQL, No-SQL)
  - Cloud technology (Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure)
- Optionally, knowledge of data processing and data modeling algorithms and techniques
- **A Doer:**  you get things done and inspire your team to do the same
- **An Analyst: ** you LOVE data and think every company should take their decisions based on facts
- **A Pragmatist:**  you have a no-nonsense mindset that seeks for practical and realistic solutions
- **A Mentor:**  your clients and colleagues naturally seek you out for advice
- **An Adventurer: ** you’re an entrepreneur constantly looking for business opportunities

 

**Why you should join us**

- **Artefact is the place to be: ** come and build the future of marketing
- **Progress:**  every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
- **Culture:**  join the best team you could ever imagine
- **Entrepreneurship: ** you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

**Come join us!**

jobs.title: Senior Data Application Engineer
jobs.description:
**Who are we ?**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven information system, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and information system are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

To support and develop its growth, Artefact is looking for the next talents of the data divizion to join the engineering team. Organized in feature team, you will work in project mode (ou pizza team) to  advise your clients on their IA problematics, machine learning and Big Data. The projects you will work on can go from the migration of infrastructure to the Cloud (Deezer) to the construction of a predictive model  of the water rises (Greenpeace).

**Your responsibilities:**

- **Innovate**. You will work with your team which is made up of consultants, data scientists, creatives and engineers to identify your clients needs and define innovatives solutions.   
  
- **Build.** You’ll take ownership of the solution from start to end. You manage both conception and implementation, while also optimising the performance and scalability.    
  
- **Train.** You will work in a collaborative  team which champions knowledge sharing. You will coach others, keep abreast of industry news/updates and get stuck into training sessions with our business partners and suppliers, such as Google & Amazon.   
  
- **Communication.** You will regularly attend events and conferences to share your knowledge, learnings and success, with the capability of presenting and communicating 

**Your mindset **

- Curious, you are always seeking innovative solutions for your clients. You are involved in all the value chain which can be, front-end, back-end, big data infrastructure, ML model … 
- Sharing of knowledge is essential for you and you actively participate in the diffusion of information within Artefact (seminaries, formations, certifications)
- Entrepreneurial, you bring solutions, new ideas, within your team at Artefact 

**Profile :**

- You act on all the value chain of projects (infrastructures and platforms creation, data collection, application of machine learning models, APIs REST creations, of front-ends, of tests, continuous deployments)
- Your studies involved software engineering, and you have experience in DevOps 
- You know how to set up and deploy NLP model provided by our data scientists 
- You are a ninja in the use and exploitation of data bus like Kafka of PubSub
- You practiced indexation system such as ElasticSearch and Vespa 
- You have a  good knowledge of python, you are really interested in the command line *nix, you are familiar or have already used  cloud technologies such as GCP or AWS, you have already used big data technologies like Flink, Spark, or Beam and Docker (K8S is an asset)
- You can popularize technical terms or solutions to more business oriented profiles, you can work in a team with very diversified profiles
- You know how to prioritize your tasks, respect deadlines, prevent in case of problems 
- You can manage a team, coach juniors, identify their axes of progress
- You can anticipate risks projects, you moderate risks when choosing for a technology 
- You have a good level of english 

**Why join us :**

-  Innovative projects and technologies, exciting
-  Really competent team, co-progression guaranteed
- Strong ambition for the data department, full of progression opportunities (technical, management)
- Recent Stack : Python, Spark, React/Redux, Google Cloud Platform (BQ, Dataflow, Compute Engine…), Nifi, HDFS, Ansible, Docker, Redis, ... 

**Come join us #FR !**

Talents-fr@artefact.com

jobs.title: Senior Data Consultant
jobs.description:
### **Who we are**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

 

**What you will be doing**

The senior consultant will manage all these actions:

- Definition of the strategy to be implemented to meet customer objectives,
- Identify the appropriate tools and make recommendations to clients;
- Implementation of relevant tools (datalake, DMP, etc…)
- Execution of campaigns, data enrichment, creation of content related to the customer journey, measurement and management of campaigns.

**What we are looking for**

Graduated from Business school or Engineering, the most important qualities in our eyes are intellectual curiosity, autonomy and dynamism.

We are looking for profiles with the double hat “business” and “data”, with at least 3 years of experience, ideally in a digital marketing consulting firm (agency, advertiser, advertising network, media, cross-functional missions), and in the use of BI tools or data analysis.

With a good technical knowledge, you already have a first understanding of digital technologies (Tracking, Machine Learning, RTB, Big Data, Platform as a Service,…).

**Why you should join us**

- **Artefact is the place to be: ** come and build the future of marketing
- **Progress:**  every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
- **Culture:**  join the best team you could ever imagine
- **Entrepreneurship: ** you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

 

**Come join us!**

Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

What you will be doing

The senior consultant will manage all these actions:

  • Definition of the strategy to be implemented to meet customer objectives,
  • Identify the appropriate tools and make recommendations to clients;
  • Implementation of relevant tools (datalake, DMP, etc…)
  • Execution of campaigns, data enrichment, creation of content related to the customer journey, measurement and management of campaigns.

What we are looking for

Graduated from Business school or Engineering, the most important qualities in our eyes are intellectual curiosity, autonomy and dynamism.

We are looking for profiles with the double hat “business” and “data”, with at least 3 years of experience, ideally in a digital marketing consulting firm (agency, advertiser, advertising network, media, cross-functional missions), and in the use of BI tools or data analysis.

With a good technical knowledge, you already have a first understanding of digital technologies (Tracking, Machine Learning, RTB, Big Data, Platform as a Service,…).

Why you should join us

  • *Artefact is the place to be: * come and build the future of marketing
  • Progress: every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
  • Culture: join the best team you could ever imagine
  • *Entrepreneurship: * you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

Come join us!

** #FR **

jobs.title: Senior Data Scientist
jobs.description:
**Who we are**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

**What you will be doing: Key responsibilities**

As a Senior Data Scientist, your role will encompass:

- Leading  and conducting ambitious projects in the transformation of clients through data
- Having a contributor role in raising the level of competencies of the data science team
- Harnessing the expertise from the other Divisions (Activation, Creativity, and Strategy) to provide comprehensive services to your clients
- Developing privileged relationships with our clients, using your technical abilities to assist in the transformation of their marketing department
- You’ll also participate in international projects. Business travel is something you enjoy!

Among your responsibilities as Senior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for:

**Leading data projects**

- Managing the resources on your projects to ensure challenges and skills are well match
- Securing delivery on your projects
- Communicating the successes of your projects among the company
- Working closely with your Consulting counterpart to build and maintain strong relationships with your clients and best understand their needs
- Caring for the happiness of the team, ensuring work is delivered to a high standard and providing feedback and mentoring

**Being a great tech role model**

- Demonstrating the skill and credibility required to ensure the success of our clients’ initiatives
- Researching and developing new technical approaches to address problems efficiently
- Sharing best practices and contributing to Artefact’s institutional knowledge
- Embodying Artefact’s values and inspiring others to do the same

**Qualifications: Education & experience required**

- A Master’s degree in machine learning, mathematics, computer science, or related fields
- 2+ years of hands-on experience developing and applying data-driven solutions in a corporate or consulting setting, preferably in a consumer marketing context (experience in the web industry is a plus)
- Strong experience and knowledge of data processing, data modeling, algorithms, and data architecture
- Experience leading  a technical project in a business context
- Intellectual curiosity and excellent problem-solving skills, including the ability to structure and prioritise an approach for maximum impact

**What we are looking for**

- **A Doer:**  you get things done and inspire your teams to do the same
- **An Analyst: ** you LOVE data and think every company should take their decisions with facts
- **A Pragmatist:**  you have a hacker mindset and always find the quick wins
- **A Mentor:**  your clients and teams naturally seek for advice
- **An Adventurer: ** you’re an entrepreneur constantly looking for problems to solve

**Why you should join us**

- **Artefact is the place to be: ** come and build the future of marketing
- **Progress:**  every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
- **Culture:**  join the best team you could ever imagine
- **Entrepreneurship: ** you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

jobs.title: Senior SEO Manager
jobs.description:
### **Who we are**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

### Role purpose

You will be responsible for managing the day-to-day client relationship and for the delivery of SEO projects for your clients. You will manage between £300k and £500k of SEO client revenue, partnering with your clients to drive client strategy and account profitability and to grow your business by 20% year on year.  You will manage a cross-channel team, delegating work effectively to ensure it is always of the highest possible standard and ensuring client retention and satisfaction. You will immerse yourself in the marketing world, pushing the boundaries to achieve commercial potential for clients. 

### **Main responsibilities**

**Client management**

- Manage the relationship between the agency and clients with a revenue of between £300k and £500k
- Work with the Account Director to develop a business growth plan for your clients, ensuring 20% year on year growth and a strategy plan for existing business that meets client needs
- Ensure delivery against the agreed business growth and strategy plan
- Maintain client retention and satisfaction, retaining 80% of your clients and maintaining a client satisfaction score of 8/10
- Run monthly business reviews for each of your clients
- Project-manage and deliver end-to-end SEO campaign performance, monitoring project performance, timelines and budgets and communicating on these regularly
- Manage the day-to-day relationship with clients, building and maintaining strong working relationships so that they trust and value your opinions
- Liaise with clients regularly (responding to briefs, attending meetings, status reporting, information seeking, managing milestones and approvals)
- Identify and resolve issues before they arise
- Give good strategic advice to clients based upon previous experience
- Manage and work collaboratively with cross channel teams to ensure the best result for your clients,

**Commercial awareness**

- Identify opportunities for driving business growth and highlight these to the Account Director, agreeing plans to deliver these
- Improve working methods with clients on a continual basis
- Involvement in pitching as required
- Produce case studies, research documents and other collateral

**SEO delivery**

-  Lead the delivery of on-site and off-site SEO campaigns for key client accounts in order to increase performance and drive success
-  Proactively recommend changes to drive campaign success and ensure these are delivered effectively by your team
- Lead your team in the production of advanced and detailed keyword research to identify the most effective and targeted key phrases for each client’s SEO campaign
-  Proactively define best practice methodology and ensure it is applied to all campaigns
-  Lead your team in the production of detailed technical SEO reports, using a variety of proprietary and 3rd party reporting tools for existing and potential customers. Present the results of these reports to stakeholders 
- Use a variety of analytical tools to assess competitor activity and profiles, establish client share of voice and spot opportunities for growth
-  Understand the client’s products and services, and use this to drive client search marketing campaign and objectives
- Carry out objective testing of SEO tools resources and techniques
- Proactively seek training and continuing professional development to stay up to date with developments, algorithm updates and process changes.

 

**Leadership & management**

- Ensure that everyone you manage has regular appraisals, clear objectives and a career plan to work towards and that they have the skills required to meet your client’s objectives
- Deputise for the Account Director when necessary.

 

**Skills required**

**Essential**

- Five years’ digital marketing agency experience
- Broad digital marketing knowledge with an in-depth understanding of search marketing and the factors that influence client websites, search profiles and performance. Record of applying this knowledge to achieve results for clients
- Ability to multi-task in a fast-moving environment
- Excellent project and campaign management skills, with experience of managing budgets, estimates and schedules
- Strong client management skills with the proven ability to add value to clients
- Strong problem-solving/troubleshooting skills
- Experience of running projects of £50k + from start to finish
- Experience of managing a team

### **Desirable**

- Experience of running projects of £100k plus

### **Technical**

- Basic HTML / CSS / JavaScript or Jquery Knowledge
-  Experience with SEO tools such as Screaming Frog, SEMrush, aHREFs, Brightedge, Linkdex and Moz
- Experience with Google Analytics, Omniture, Site Catalyst (or other analytics tools), Google and Bing Search Console and SEO performance measurement using these tools
- Basic knowledge of Google Tag Manager and tag creation
- Detailed understanding of technical SEO best practice including HTML meta tags, URL structure, schema.org markup  for desktop and mobile search
-  Knowledge of robots control and site indexing principles including robots.txt, meta robots tags, canonical tag, XML sitemaps
- Up-to-date knowledge of  key search algorithms and google best practice guidelines
- Ability to identify low quality SEO practices such as link building or cloaking
- Experience developing organic search strategies including site architecture changes, robots control, schema.org
- Experience with writing HTTP redirect rules for website migration strategies including Apache
- Experience writing HREF Lang mark-up and developing international SEO strategies.Appreciation of UX best practice principles and how these should align with SEO recommendations
- Solid understanding of paramater handling, pagination, filtering and duplicate content solutions
- Experience implementing complex organic search marketing strategies such as mobile app deep indexing, AMP and using other technologies to improve organic performance
- Experience with SEO KPI definition and SEO Forecasting

jobs.title: Technical SEO Consultant (m/f/d)
jobs.description:
**Who we are**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specialising in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 1000 employees across 20 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

 

**What you will be doing**

**Daily technical management of SEO projects for a portfolio of clients:**

- Supporting national and international client projects and developing strategic SEO concepts
- Consulting for our clients based on onsite analyses and regular monitoring of your SEO activities supported by tracking and reporting tools
- Contributing your expertise to the team and working together on both technical and content related SEO topics
- Assuming responsibility in a specific professional field based on your preferences and individual strengths and acting as first point of contact
- Carrying out advanced technical audits: crawl, logs, correlation, action plan
- Production of recommendations and follow-up of implementations as a thread
- Dashboard analysis (Google Datastudio) of performance in the form of a deliverable
- Presenting results to our clients and designing and moderating individual client workshops

 

**What we are looking for**

- Approx. 3 years of professional experience and a passion for or a strong interest in all topics related to search engine optimization
- A solid technical understanding of websites and a very good on-page expertise
- Proficiency in some of the common analysis tools such as Search Console, ScreamingFrog, Deep Crawl and Analytics, Botify / OnCrawl, Sistrix, Searchmetrics
- Well developed analytical skills
- A professional approach to customers combined with strong communication skills
- Enganged Teamplayer with a high level of personal responsibility
- MS Office skills
- Fluent German and English skills both oral and written
   

**Why you should join us**

- **Artefact is the place to be: ** come and build the future of marketing
- **Progress:**  every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
- **Culture:**  join the best team you could ever imagine
- **Entrepreneurship: ** you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won’t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

 

**Come join us!**

jobs.title: VP Engineering
jobs.description:
Artefact est une société nouvelle génération spécialisée dans le conseil en data et en marketing digital data-driven.

 

**Notre objectif ?**

Nous contribuons tous les jours à transformer la data de nos clients en impact business, que ce soit des projets IA, du Conseil en Stratégie Data et en Marketing Digital jusqu'à la gestion du Mix-Média et plus encore !

 

**Notre force ?**

Nos services data reposent sur une double expertise : l'utilisation de l’Intelligence Artificielle et des compétences métiers acquises auprès de nos clients dans le monde, tels que AccorHotels, Orange, Carrefour, Engie, Samsung, L’Oréal, Nissan...  La force d'Artefact émane d’un mix unique d'atouts : des technologies data de pointe, des méthodes agiles permettant de délivrer très rapidement les projets et des équipes composées des meilleurs experts dans leurs domaines (business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, ingénieurs data). 

 

Dans ce contexte, **  Artefact** vise à recruter un.e VP Engineering pour diriger le pôle engineering, et travailler avec nos clients sur les projets de développement de grand envergure. 

 

**Le pole Engineering **

 

Le pôle engineering a pour mission de concevoir, développer et déployer les solutions techniques contribuant à cette transformation. 

 

Que ce soit la construction de plateformes data, ou la production d’applications ML/IA, l’équipe engineering intervient à tous les niveaux de la stack technique : 

 

- Infrastructure, réseaux, sécurité
- Workflows, CI/CD, GitOps
- Plateformes data, datalakes, clusters de compute Spark/K8S
- Data pipelines, ML applications
- APIs, Microservices, WebApps

 

Artefact porte des convictions fortes Cloud Native, et tire bénéfice des nouvelles technologies d'hybridation pour appliquer ces principes même dans des écosystèmes legacy ou on-prem.

 

Le pôle engineering collabore en feature teams avec des data scientists, product owners, data analysts et consultants en stratégie afin de livrer les solutions les plus pertinentes et impactantes pour nos clients.

 

**Tes responsabilités **

 

- Reportant au Managing Partner France, tu dirigeras l’équipe engineering, composée de 30 software, data, et ops engineers, et solution architects, et sera responsable de la conception et l’exécution de la stratégie de l’équipe, ainsi que de sa croissance.   
  
- Tu seras responsable de la conception et le delivery des solutions techniques de nos clients, en lien fort avec les équipes de conseil et data science, et tu interviendras régulièrement auprès de nos clients en tant que subject matter expert.  
  
- Tu sera responsable de la construction et la consolidation d’actifs technologiques et méthodologiques propres à Artefact qui assureront faciliteront et accéléreront le bon delivery et l’industrialisation de nos projets chez nos clients. 

 

- Tu entretiendras des relations étroites avec nos partenaires, principalement Google Cloud et Microsoft Azure.   
  

**Ton profil **

 

- Tu as une forte appétence et expérience technique, et une préférence personnelle à continuer à produire et livrer des projets techniques.  
  
- Tu a des convictions fortes sur l’avenir des technologies cloud, comme la containerisation et les technologies serverless.  
  
- Tu as une expérience confirmée dans l’organisation et le pilotage d’équipes de profils techniques, ainsi que la mise en application de méthodologies de développement et delivery prouvées.  
  
- Tu as démontré une capacité à faire grandir ton équipe, tirer tes collaborateurs vers le haut, et former les prochaines générations de managers techniques.  
  
- Tu as déjà managé une équipe en forte croissance, et a déjà surmonté les problèmes organisationnelles engendrés par cette croissance.  
  
- Tu as une capacité à aligner et convaincre les différentes parties-prenantes (techniques ou non) d’un projet, contribuant à une vision claire et partagée   
  
- Tu sais travailler au sein d’une équipe composée de profils différents (data scientists, créatifs, consultants, product owners, etc.) et contribuer à une dynamique collaborative s’appuyant sur la complémentarité des compétences.

jobs.title: paid social executive - entry - open
jobs.description:
### **Who we are**

Artefact is a new generation of a data service provider, specializing in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing, dedicated to transforming data into business impact across the entire value chain of organizations. We are proud to say we’re enjoying skyrocketing growth.

Our broad range of data-driven solutions in data consulting and digital marketing are designed to meet our clients’ specific needs, always conceived with a business-centric approach, and delivered with tangible results. Our data-driven services are built upon the deep AI expertise we’ve acquired with our 1000+ client base around the globe.

We have 700+ employees across 16 offices who are focused on accelerating digital transformation. Thanks to a unique mix of company assets: State of the art data technologies, lean AI agile methodologies for fast delivery, and cohesive teams of the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital experts, all dedicated to bringing extra value to every client.

 

**The Role **

You will be part of the paid social team and focus on the day-to-day running of paid social marketing campaigns across a range of clients and markets, delivering exceptional performance on sales and/or branding goals. You will work together with our data analytics team to provide high standards of tracking & tagging campaigns. You will research and prepare analysis, undertake paid social delivery work and liaise with clients, third party suppliers and internal teams to ensure optimal delivery, account development, and the strengthening of client relationships. Next to that, you work together with the other media specialists (programmatic, SEA, SEO, and marketplaces) to deliver data-driven results for our clients.

### **General responsibilities**

- Support the team with the day-to-day running of paid social marketing campaigns with a focus on Facebook advertising
- Understand and explain the role of social media advertising to reach the business  objectives for our clients
- Take responsibility for key areas of paid social delivery assigned to you by members of the team
- Carry out research for existing projects and for new business
- Research and prepare reports, budgets, presentations, analysis, and campaign delivery
- Coordinate with internal project teams and third-party suppliers
- Take on ad-hoc tasks as required

### **Paid social responsibilities**

- Traffic, implement, and optimize social ad campaigns. Troubleshoot issues with campaigns, creative, and implementations as they arise
- Create social ad campaigns for any vertical and strategy (branding, prospecting, retargeting)
- Take an analytical approach to interpret data to adjust our strategy
- Work with your colleagues to optimize campaigns and maximize performance across common KPI’s – ROI, CPA, COS, Revenue, Clicks, Impressions and Reach
- Align with media partners on campaign implementations, including using their ad servers, as necessary
- Own and manage in house reporting tool to retrieve data for campaign delivery analysis and optimization recommendations
- Develop and build out the relationship with the client: providing accurate reporting, present results, providing advice, and build performance-oriented paid social campaigns with a strong focus on quality and deadlines

### **Who are you?**

- 1+ year experience in a paid social environment
- Academic and working ability at the higher professional education level (HBO) or higher
- Entrepreneurial, engaged, flexible and data-driven mindset
- Ability to multi-task in a fast-moving environment
- Excellent attention to detail
- Demonstrate knowledge in Paid Social ads platform: Facebook Business Manager
- Pre: Certified Facebook Blueprint marketing associate or higher
- Good understanding of site-centric tools (Google Analytics preferred)
- Strong skills in spreadsheets (Excel/sheets) and creating presentations
- Great communication skills
- Ability to work full time
- Fluency in Dutch and English is required

**What do we offer?**

- Attractive benefits package
- The chance to work in a diverse and growing team
- The opportunity for professional and personal growth and development
- Excellent (international) career opportunities
- The opportunity to work with major advertisers and brands on a national and international level
- Fun colleagues and an informal and open atmosphere
- A great office in the heart of Utrecht (Stationsplein)
- Fun activities, such as drinks and excursions
- A full lunch, fresh fruit and great coffee daily  
  

**What makes us unique?**

- We have experienced colleagues from the Netherlands and abroad. We achieve our ambitions together
- We are the only independent online performance marketing agency that operates worldwide
- We are growing fast: at Artefact Benelux, aspirations and fun go hand in hand
